comments.html: PBR configuration management? Ok, that's pretty cool.  But it sounds like something you could easily do with NETCONF on standard hardware.
comments.name: Brad Hedlund

comments.html:
The way I understood Dave Ward's explanation (when he was still @ Juniper ;), Junos installs OpenFlow entries in RIB (whereas Brocade installs them in FIB), making it possible to treat them like any other route (including route redistribution into other protocols).

When I see it working, I'll believe :D
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html: Ahh, subtle difference.  Yes, seeing is believing.  Thanks!
comments.name: Anonymous

comments.html:
Ivan,
You mentioned this is similar to what Juniper is doing w/ integrated OpenFlow. I read through both articles and they do seem to be pretty much the same. Which leads me to my question.

How do they actually differ? Is the Brocade switch one or the other but not both modes at the same time? I see Juniper gives OF a route preference but it appears Brocade look into the OF FIB first-much like a default route or match, then regular processing.

Thanks for the great articles!
comments.name: Anonymous

comments.html:
Can someone please explain the difference between "Traditional Openflow" enabled port and "Openflow Hybrid enabled but Unprotected" port?
Thanks,
JD
comments.name: Anonymous
